name: 4-(4-methoxybenzylidene)-2-phenyl-1,3-oxazol-5(4H)-one
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3922
Reason: 4-methoxybenzylidene group introduces a bulky structure with increased molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +20. The phenyl group contributes to the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl is estimated to add approximately +30 due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The methoxybenzylidene group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10. The oxazole ring introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10.
